channel.title: My website
channel.description:
Okay changed thread a bit. Hows about you view my website and tell me what I can do it improve:
www.tubbaz.com
This is for university coursework and it really only has to be basic. I'm also still working on it as it's pretty shit atm.
P.S. - ITS HTML 5 so if you aren't using chrome or firefox 4 then it's not going to look right

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Okay how is it looking now? I still haven’t written all the content yet so most of the pages are just a copy of my university page.

Most of my tasks are finished, but I have two more goals:
Finish writing the content
Embed a video using the html 5 video tag

tl;dr moar c & c please

p.s. if you aren’t using firefox latest beta, or chrome, then it wont look how it’s supposed to.

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

maybe give it a background & border of some sort? set opacity to 40% if you want to keep some of your current background, idk keep trying until you like it

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Rix_:

Your website is too wide for the content you have!

That’s what she said!

I’m not sure… I don’t want to make it much wider because then I’ll have to write more content to bulk it out. I could just increase the font maybe

Ollie:

960px is good, use some sort of definition for your content to make it stand out, border or background different?

i don’t understand any of what you just said

edit - just increased width of text to 960px and I think it does look better, what could I do to give the content more definition?

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Okay slowly getting there. It’s looking how I want it to so really now all I need to do is write content. Still c&c though please.

One problem I have at the moment is getting a password protected file using htpasswd
my htpasswd file is located in the root of my website in a folder called /.htpasswd/
I assumed to access it I could do:
authuserfile root/.htpasswds/.htpasswd

but I don’t think it’s finding it and I can’t find out how to access /.htpasswd/

halp ty

p.s. making a password protected folder/section is part of the coursework and we only need to use the most basic htaccess hax to make it work so yeh

Read full topic

Also not decided on what colours the h2s will be

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:9, topic:374779”]also using /hobbies/ etc is bad, use .htaccess and make a rewrite rule

RewriteRule ^[a-z0-9_-]+/([0-9]+)\.html$ /$1/ [L,NC] (this is off top of head)

then you can use hobbies.html instead[/quote]

I’m pretty sure that’s a myth. Search engines will index both equally as well, this isn’t 1997.

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

It sucks balls that is all.

fuck off honkey bitch!!!

[quote=“chri5, post:7, topic:374779”]Make the nav bar show what page you’re currently on.

PS: show your src <3[/quote]
I’ll show source after I’ve handed it in otherwise my lecturer might come to the forum thinking I stole it

[quote=“Ollie, post:9, topic:374779”]very cluttered, and bad use of colours, background is too dark with a content background that is also too dark. you need light on dark or dark on light. also its very “mono” with the blue.

edit: also using /hobbies/ etc is bad, use .htaccess and make a rewrite rule

RewriteRule ^[a-z0-9_-]+/([0-9]+)\.html$ /$1/ [L,NC] (this is off top of head)

then you can use hobbies.html instead[/quote]
Why is using /hobbies/ bad and what is the alternative? Do you mean whenever you are on the site it should only be www.tubbaz.com in the address bar? If so even if that is bad practice our lecturer specifically asked us to section it like this(i think).
Pwnd_ already helped me with .htaccess in formatting my php $get shit into just /section/
e.g. instead of having www.tubbaz.com/?page=content3
it would just be www.tubbaz.com/content/

Thanks for taking time to help. I’ll hopefully work on this bitch again properly over boxing day

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

very cluttered, and bad use of colours, background is too dark with a content background that is also too dark. you need light on dark or dark on light. also its very “mono” with the blue.

edit: also using /hobbies/ etc is bad, use .htaccess and make a rewrite rule

RewriteRule ^[a-z0-9_-]+/([0-9]+)\.html$ /$1/ [L,NC] (this is off top of head)

then you can use hobbies.html instead

Read full topic

item.title: My website
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:5, topic:374779”][quote author=thepinksock link=topic=470744.msg3442679#msg3442679 date=1293170402]
I suppose this thread might as well be about constructive criticism now. What can I do to improve?
[/quote]
Make the NAV bar separate the header and your other shit[/quote]
Is this personal preference or is it bad practice to have the NAV bar inside the header?

What I’m aiming for atm is a header just like facebooks, stretches the entire page with TITLE and nav next to each other at the same width as the body

Read full topic
